channel.title: Reverse Polish Notation
channel.description:
Alrite, well.. My college has just set me a new target; "I will research into Reverse Polish Notation and how it is used in computing".. This isn't for an assignment as it comes under "Personal Development".
I know what Reverse Polish Notation is; It's a different way of doing algebraic notation that is what nearly everyone is used to; It's in the postfix form.. Such as..
Algebraic: 5 + 3 = Postfix (RPN): 5 3 +
But I don't understand how it's used in computers; I know HP used RPN in calculators but that's all, can anyone explain?

item.title: Reverse Polish Notation
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

algebraic rofl learn what infix is. the significance of reverse polish notation is that virtually every arithmetic stack machine uses it in a sense. if you’re interested in prefix tell him to look at some functional languages like lisp.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

practically? i have no idea
writing a rpn calculator is a good exercise when learning a new language/paradigm, though

item.title: Reverse Polish Notation

item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Alrite, well… My college has just set me a new target; “I will research into Reverse Polish Notation and how it is used in computing”… This isn’t for an assignment as it comes under “Personal Development”.

I know what Reverse Polish Notation is; It’s a different way of doing algebraic notation that is what nearly everyone is used to; It’s in the postfix form… Such as…

Algebraic: 5 + 3 =
Postfix (RPN): 5 3 +

But I don’t understand how it’s used in computers; I know HP used RPN in calculators but that’s all, can anyone explain?
